It has a similar mix of action, humor, and historical/cultural references that made Pirates of the Caribbean enjoyable.
* The Mummy (1999) - This adventure horror film follows an American expedition team that unleashes a powerful mummy in Egypt, leading to a thrilling adventure filled with action, suspense, and supernatural elements. It has a similar blend of excitement and humor as Pirates of the Caribbean.

Of course! I'd be happy to recommend some historical movies based on your interest in the genre. Here are two films that come to mind:

* "Schindler's List" (1993) - A powerful and emotional drama that tells the true story of Oskar Schindler, a German businessman who saves the lives of thousands of Jews during the Holocaust. Directed by Steven Spielberg and featuring an all-star cast, this film is both heartbreaking and uplifting.
* "Gladiator" (2000) - A visually stunning epic that explores the tale of a Roman general who becomes a gladiator and seeks revenge against the corrupt emperor who killed his family. Directed by Ridley Scott and featuring an electrifying performance by Russell Crowe, this film is a thrilling ride from start to finish.
